reviewText:
A first person view horror game, with lame  jump scares.

you have a flashlight that needs batteries, you also need to find keys to unlock doors.

if your flashlight runs out, you will die and respawn at the beginning.
but your progress is NOT lost,  so just run quickly back from where you died last..

Keys and batteries does not respawn.
the gameplay is about 15-20 minutes

I do recommand turning your flashlight off when possible,
Do not pick up the Yellow batteries if you don't need them !
you can't stack them. and  there aren't many in the game.
pressing ESC closes the game, and there is no save option.

Enjoy.

reviewText:
As soon as I noticed the typo inconsistency in the title I knew there was something wrong with the game. Not to mention the trailer in the store page which is in fact a compilation of Let's Play footage taken from Youtube.

As I launch the game my greatest fears were confirmed : BlackShadows doesn't have any menu. Instead of opening on the title screen the game throws you directly into gameplay, where the scary part actually ends...

Basically, the game consist of making your way through a dark maze-like environment with your flashlight. Since batteries in indie horror games can't last longer than any generic brand batteries sold at Walmart, you'll have no choice but to pickup new ones every two minutes.

In addition, the game features only one level and it lasts no longer than 20 minutes. Once you get at the end of the game you will feel no sense of accomplishment since nothing explains what you have actually done to solve the mystery behind the paranormal phenomenon that afflicts the whole humanity.

To conclude, BlackShadows aka Black Shadows is nothing else but another indie game that tries to cow milk on the success of great horror games such as Amnesia and Outlast (let's not talk about Slender, please). Considering its short lenght the 5$ price tag just feels like a total rip-off. Even though I bought the game while it was on sale I still think it wasn't worth my money.

If you have 12 minutes, you can watch my whole playthrough below :
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AwaMvea-zNY

P.S.: Is it just me or the narrator has a French Canadian accent?

Rating :
1.0

>game closes
>start game 2nd time
>story goes on as I move through the level
>after 1-2 minutes of walking I reach a door
>press e on it then it shows me the controls(very intuitive)
>stuck at controls screen for 2 minutes bc pressing space didn't work
>somehow something kills me and I have to respawn
>respawn, same control screen,still stuck
>Close game, open it 3rd time
>Story goes on but the screen is black
>open console, write exit
10/10 the console is magnific.

reviewText:
There's only one way to die in BlackShadows and that is to let your flashlight batteries run out. And I do mean 'let' because there's enough of them lying around to power a shuttle launch.

Your average Kindle book requires more interaction than this. There are five doors to open, the keys to which lie varying distances away through linear corridors. There is no threat. There's no menu. There's two scares where a light blows out and a lightning crash illuminates your would-be adversary in a corridor but neither of them affect anything you're doing. Listening to the opening/closing narration takes almost half as long as it does to beat the game. Utterly, inarguably pointless.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=82kCBXgJ9CQ

reviewText:
Oh boy. First things first. That Lets Play video that those youngsters are playing over hype this so bad. They scream and throw their hands up at lights exploding, doors shutting, and a light man appearing. I played this game myself last night and none of these things are scary. Theres no music to set the creepy atmosphere. The only constant noise is the white noise from the walking sound effect.

There no menu, no options, no story, no info. You hit play on steam and it throws you into the game. Once you get to the end, which doesn't feel like an accompishment, you get a yay you beat the game screen, and hit escape to completely exit out of the game.

Luckily I did not pay for this game, I got emailed the key from the developer because I guess I voted for this game on greenlight. That had to be well over a year ago. I don't know what I was thinking to allow them to release this on here.

In my girlfriend and I's playthrough I made a short rant at the start of the video. For anyone interested in this game, watch the 25 minutes (thats with 2 death resets) it took us to beat it. Ai yi yi....

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1hWSIFjwLfg

reviewText: An incredibly ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• horror game which was made even more terrible by the fact that there was just nothing worth of a screenshot. I'm serious, apart from the cheesy white figure that appears for about a frame there was nothing interesting to take a picture of. Just bland textures in the worlds blandest version of Outlast with bland jump scares if you're lucky because this game seems to think text is scary. I didn't play through the entire game even though I've heard that the game play is only around 20 minutes which is something akin of $0.50 worth of game if that. The thing that did this game in for me the most was the fact that I pressed Esc to pause, seeing as that's something even the most thread bare of games seem to have, only to have the game close on me. When I reopened the game, it seemed to restart the story only it wouldn't let me turn on my flashlight even though I had a full battery. Definetely do not get this game unless you're like me and get cheap bundles and free game giveaways all the time. Even then I would still say don't play it unless you want your brain to run out your ears and not even have any trading cards to show for it.

If you like walking simulators and it happens to be in a bundle, why not add another notch on your keyboard? I finished it in the 0.5 hrs I played, so don't expect a lot. It's like a small school project.

The intro is just a black screen, piano music plays, and a female narrator starts talking quietly soon. Don't worry about it, just listen.

reviewText:
I can't remember how the crap I got this game.
Dark Hallway Stroll Simulator
The best part of this game was how I could turn the flashlight off, and then turn it back on again. I discovered that as long as the batteries aren't totally dead, nothing bad will happen. That is until you see ANOTHER BOX.

Box Design

The box design is amazing. Everywhere you look, there are boxes on shelves. Gosh darn terrifying, I tell ya hwut. If you've ever thought that the perfect game could be made up of corridors, shelves, boxes, and AA batteries, then the perfect game has been made for you.

Ahhh! You Scared Me, You Scary Game!

I love how there are screams that let you know when things are scary. If the game didn't have those, it would suffer from a lack of content. However, the screams that you hear let you know exactly when the intended scary stuff happens, otherwise you would be just as confused and aimless as you were prior to the screaming.

The Soundtrack

The developer's decision to include the widely-appreciated pop hit 4'33 by composer John Cage shouldn't be seen as anything but incredible genius. The engaging soundtrack of silence absolutely sucks...

WAIT FOR IT

...the player in and sets the perfect tone of suspense and  FEAR for the 25 minutes or so that you'll be playing the game. I should note that the piece is played on repeat
date:
to make sure that you hear it. I just can't get enough of 4'33" - The perfect classical composition.

Overall

Who wouldn't want to play this game? I mean

reviewText: BlackShadows is a horror game, where you walk around in some kind of deserted place. Your only item is a flashlight that you can  use to light up dark places, but it needs batteries to stay alive. Your main objective is collecting keys and opening doors. Game usually takes like 15-20 minutes to finish. This game looks more like a demo, than a real full game.  I can't believe they are actually selling this game for an 2.99 ‚Ç¨ on steam. Rip-off at it's finest. I didn't get any enjoyment out of this game and trust me, you won't get any enjoyment out of it either. Just stay away from this horrible game !
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Black Shadows sounded like a good idea at the time.
=======

CONS:

- MONOTONOUS: Find the key, open the door. Pickup batteries to keep the flashlight lit.

- LACK OF STORY: No real story here, but it's telling a narrative about a lady and her recurring nightmares. It's interesting, but... lacking. It gives enough monologue to let you know that something is happening (no spoilers for ideas and interpretations), but not enough to make it feel fleshed out enough. It's just.. lacking.

- LACK OF SCARES: It's not scary :( The only slightly creepy thing was seeing Silver Surfer appear in front of me, slightly perturbed by his own lack of clothing. No offense meant, devs~!

- ENVIRONMENT/TEXTURES: Somebody really likes empty wire-spools, metal shelving, and fire extinguishers. The only interesting thing in the game was the teddy bear, and I couldn't even pick it up! It disappeared :(

- NO REPLAYABILITY: Play it once, beat it, you're done.

- TOO SHORT: It's exceedingly short. I finished it in less than 20 minutes :l

-/+ Voice Acting: It's not bad, but, it's not great. I can tell that it was done by someone who was invested in what they were doing, but, it's a little, well... lacking. I can't think of better words here, but, overall this game just fell short of what I believe they were aiming for. It could have been well refined, tweaked, and expanded to create a more interesting environment and playthrough, but... as with that, the voice acting could have been more intense to suit the mood. I'm including this one under both PROS and CONS, because she didn't do a bad job, but rather, it was just lacking. That's up to the dev to get right (assuming they're not the same person...? I didn't pay attention to the credits... Sorry~!)


PROS:

+/- Voice acting: She did a fairly decent job, but... it's just not intense enough, yadda yadda yadda. You've read this already under the CONS section. I've placed it in both, so it neither weighs for nor against it.

+ BUILD-UP: When I say Build-up"
date: I mean this one point where "you've been seen"
recommended: and "he's coming for you". It really threw me into a slightly cautious mindset
hoursPlayed: because I didn't know what the game was going to throw at me. Sadly
